alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Lee; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 7:20PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Williamson, Travis, northeastern Bastrop and northern Lee Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 720 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thorndale to near Hutto to near Anderson Mill to near Spicewood. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Austin, Round Rock, Cedar Park, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Lexington, Anderson Mill, Windemere, Hutto, Lakeway, Manor, Lago Vista, Bee Cave, West Lake Hills, Hudson Bend, The Hills, Rollingwood, Thrall and Dime Box. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
